channel.title: I kill You when You Log!
channel.description: I call this post Project "I kill You when You Log" For this reason; Whenever a new user logs in, he dies. So he loses what he starts with. How can I remove this so that when a new user logs in, he doesn't die RIGHT AWAY. This way he doesn't lose everthing he logs in with. :confused: :| :confused: :| :confused: :| :confused: :| :confused:

item.title: I kill You when You Log!
item.dc:creator: @ZTR_Zac ZTR Zac
item.description:
@ZTR_Zac wrote:

Erm, i’m not exactly sure why this happens i’ve had this problem before with a base source cant remember what source it was. Im not sure why but it sounds asthough the client is accidently calling applyDead() when a new user starts. I wouldn’t be able to tell you how to fix it without the code but heres one way. Find the code which is called when a new account is made. Check to see if anything is out of place. Thats all i can say without having the code in front of me

Read full topic
item.source: I kill You when You Log!

item.title: I kill You when You Log!
item.dc:creator: @valiken valiken
item.description:
@valiken wrote:

I call this post Project “I kill You when You Log”
For this reason;
Whenever a new user logs in, he dies. So he loses what he starts with. How can I remove this so that when a new user logs in, he doesn’t die RIGHT AWAY. This way he doesn’t lose everthing he logs in with.

Read full topic
